instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_G3H: What is 3V3_G3H? This is one of the first power rails that must turn on for Macbooks that use USB-C for charging. This power rail powers the CD3215 chip that controls the USB-C charger, speaks to the USB-C charger, and requests 20 volts up from the default 5 volts that the USB-C charger puts out when initially connected to an unknown device. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
Not powering on liquid damaged. I get 20V on <TRANSISTOR>Q3200</TRANSISTOR> <SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS_F</SIGNAL> but its not opening. Which means I am not getting <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>. I replaced already <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> thinking it was the cause of not opening the gate on <TRANSISTOR>Q3200</TRANSISTOR>. What could be the reason of not opening?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message: Voltage on <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> currently? Did you use the correct <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> 0v.
Yes same <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message:
Are you using original Apple charger???
Strange to get 20V before talking with SMC...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message: Good Point. Ok I tried a original cable, once its plugged the amp meter reads 5v then starts to go up and shuts down and restart.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message: Does it bootloop on all 4 ports? Does PP3v3 go to 3.3 volts?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message: Yes it does the same on all of them. No pp3v3 present

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message: Resistance to ground on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>? I suspect something is pulling it down and causing your bootlooping

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message:
Check if <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> pulses at least.
Also try to start in SMC bypass mode.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> pulses at least?
Test resistance to ground there too (diode mode).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message:
241k resistance to ground on <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>
1.195v Diode  mode on <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> 

I hate these new models

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message: Start by checking what 2informaticos said guessing PPBUS won?t be present. Inject 3.3 volts into <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> and monitor for any kind of amperage draw

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message: I injected 3.3v on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>. no amperage draw. I guess theres a short on some of the lines thats why when it tries to reach 20v  it goes on a loop not passing more than 5v. I will check lines for short. Any ideas you guys can add?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message:
Remove F7000 and check if get steady 12.5-13V on its pin1.
I suppose a problem on a secondary power supply.
Check resistance to ground on all coils...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message:
Checked resistance to ground and no short.
I dont get anything on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>. I guess Im not getting <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> cos there's no 20v on <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message:
Did you remove F7000 and check voltage at its pin 1?
I think there is CD3215C00, did you use the same, from donor?
B03 version will not work, as new chip too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message: Yes I removed fuse and I get 0v. Yes positive, I used c00 chip. Not from donor board I got the chip itself already reballed. I will try to use the one on donor board and Ill post back.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message: Replaced from a donor board and now its working fine. BUT it's overheating, fan not spinning and shutting down itself because overheat. Keyboard is working fine. I know this keyboard goes connected to the fan. any points to test?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message: What is overheating the new chip or the computer in general? Run HWMonitor and report if any sensors read off if possible

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message: CPU is overheating because fan is not spinning and it shuts down after a few minutes on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message:
Was the fan connector affected by liquid spill?
Try other fan too...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message: Yeah I would say try new fans in that case.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message: Trackpad cable has corrosion on connector, do you think it affects the fan ? not sure if trackpad and keyboard communicate each other on this model. Both fans look perfect.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message: Trackpad has temp sensor embedded, Palm Rest sensor...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message: Ok Ill try to replace trackpad cable first.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message: Ok after replacing Usb Controller chip (DONOR BOARD) its powering up. Fan didnt work due trackpad cable with corrosion. Clean and re-solder pins on connector fan spinning and now is a happy MacBook. Thank you guys. SOLVED.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message: Nice job! Just learned something new too with the trackpad issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't turn on. Liquid damaged.
threads.message:
Really strange, older Macs get max fan if palm rest sensor is not correctly detected.
If possible, someone with similar machine, to remove trackpad and check if fan doesn't really spin.
That will be good feedback...
